description: {"blocks":[{"key":"an2fj","text":"The following protocol describes the acoustic droplet ejection dispenses needed for a minitaturized 16S PCR reaction using the Echo 550. The protocol expects (1) 384-Well 16S Illumina Primer Plate in an echo qualified Low Dead Volume (LDV) plate, (1) 384-Well Extracted gDNA in an echo qualified Polypropylene (PP) plate, and (3) 384-Well PCR Plates in twin.tec PCR plates. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"94vgf","text":"Please wear at least the minimum required personal protective equipment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4gbre","text":"Ensure that all necessary kit components are available as well as user-supplied consumables.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"75r7c","text":"Remove nuclease and nucleotide contamination from work surfaces and instruments prior to starting using an appropriate solution, such as RNase AWAY™ (Thermo Scientific™ catalogue: 700511), followed by wiping with 70% to 100% molecular biology grade ethanol to remove additional contaminants.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"eqh5e","text":"(1) 384-Well Low Dead Volume (LDV) Echo Qualified Microplate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7gpe1","text":"(1) 384-Well Polypropylene (PP) Echo Qualified Microplate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5o3bj","text":"(3) 384-Well twin.tec  384-Well PCR Plates","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1lq43","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
protocol_affiliation: Knight Lab @ UC San Diego Health
affiliation: Knight Lab @ UC San Diego Health

authors_list.name: Rodolfo Salido Benitez
authors_list.affiliation: Knight Lab @ UC San Diego Health

status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"638m3","text":"Thaw and centrifuge primer, gDNA, and PCR plates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6qvl8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7euv7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"einv3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"2ld","text":"Centrifugation speed for echo qualified Low Dead Volume (LDV) plates must not exceed 1500rpm.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":69,"length":8,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"90406F80CB3411E88554D1E873573ABA","id":672631,"previous_id":null,"previous_guid":null,"section":"Prepare Plates"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4euom","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"97lg5","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"67d2t","text":"Survey source plates to ensure the Primer and gDNA source plates have enough material to execute the protocol to completion.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"54nnr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a2q87","text":"Open Echo 550 Liquid Handler software. Go to Diagnostics tab. Click Source Plate Out. Place plate to be surveyed in source plate tray ensuring that the instrument has the appropriate plate insert, then click Source Plate In. Select  appropriate plate profile when prompted. Under Miscellaneous, click the dropdown menu and select Survey, then click Launch. A window will pop up. Click Go in the new window to start the plate survey.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d2o2a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fsm6b","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"85jmq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1nsb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"77pn0","text":"The following steps are optional. The Knight Lab performs them to ensure enough source material is present in source plates before executing the protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}},{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"eo7vo","text":"384-Well Polypropylene (PP) plate expects the 2.10 mm insert","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d028l","text":"The Knight Lab uses the following plate profile for the PP plate: 384PP_AQ_BP2_HT","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9cs8m","text":"Working range of volumes for the PP plate is 15 - 65 \u00b5L.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7q6mg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"duv5o","text":"384-Well Low Dead Volume (LDV) plate expects the 4.50 mm insert","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"800qi","text":"The Knight Lab uses the following plate profile for the LDV plate: 384LDV_AQ_B2_HT","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fv5vp","text":"Working range of volumes for the LDV plate is 3-12 \u00b5L","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"E6361DE0CC0111E8A59E3B0F21525012","id":672935,"previous_guid":"90406F80CB3411E88554D1E873573ABA","section":"Prepare Plates"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2p1jd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3k9nf","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"8rflq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"evcvl","text":"Execute the following Echo 550 protocol to transfer 16S primers. You'll need the Echo Plate Reformat software. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ciebg","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"5l03l","text":"The protocol will transfer 200 nL of primers from each source well of the LDV source plate to the corresponding destination well for a total of 3 copies of the twin tec PCR destination plates. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5lej8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5q192","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"equipment","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":196,"guid":"26C2E080CE3E11E8A59E3B0F21525012","align":null,"brand":"Labcyte","sku":"GEN-27","specifications":"","file_id":null,"file_icon":null,"file_name":null,"image_id":null,"s3_image_name":null,"s3_file_name":null,"can_edit":true,"step_guid":"92D04610CE3D11E8A59E3B0F21525012","image_name":null,"link":null,"type":"Liquid Handling","name":"Echo 550"}},{"type":"file","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"31081","guid":"6A6CCE90CE3E11E8A59E3B0F21525012","source":"https:\/\/s3.amazonaws.com\/pr-journal\/8mj3mm6.epr","placeholder":"\/img\/extensions\/file.png","original_name":"Mini-PCR_primer_dispense.epr"}}],"guid":"92D04610CE3D11E8A59E3B0F21525012","id":673650,"previous_guid":"E6361DE0CC0111E8A59E3B0F21525012","section":"Execute acoustic droplet ejection transfers"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"csjrm","text":"Execute the following Echo 550 protocol to trasnfer gDNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7cguf","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"fi8ui","text":"The protocol will transfer 200 nL of gDNA from each source well of the PP source plate to the corresponding destination well for a total of 3 copies of the same twin tec PCR destination plates used in last step. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d10ev","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"file","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"31095","guid":"D4E8A230CE3E11E8A59E3B0F21525012","source":"https:\/\/s3.amazonaws.com\/pr-journal\/8mz3mm6.epr","placeholder":"\/img\/extensions\/file.png","original_name":"Mini-PCR_gDNA_dispense.epr"}}],"guid":"B954D980CE3E11E8A59E3B0F21525012","id":673652,"previous_guid":"92D04610CE3D11E8A59E3B0F21525012","section":"Execute acoustic droplet ejection transfers"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b3u2b","text":"Seal all source plates with storage aluminum foils.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"i4i0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1gu8h","text":"Seal all destination plates with thermo-cycler compatible aluminum foils and centrifuge them.
